too_early:
You opened the file. That's it. That's all you did.

Even YOU won't ship this.

(Minimum 20% progress required)

The deploy script laughed at you.

'There's nothing here,' it said.

(Minimum 20% progress required)

The CI/CD pipeline sent you an automated therapy referral.

(Minimum 20% progress required)

You can't ship what doesn't exist.

This isn't quantum mechanics.

(Minimum 20% progress required)

Git status: 'No changes staged for commit.'

Because you didn't do anything.

(Minimum 20% progress required)

The linter gave up trying to parse nothing.

(Minimum 20% progress required)

messages: Actually good work. You feel competent.
Clean code. A rare feeling of pride.
You even wrote tests. Who are you?
Polished. Professional. You remember what that feels like.
It works. Probably.
Good enough for production. Maybe.
The tests pass. That's something.
Functional. That's all anyone can ask for.
Not your best work, but it'll hold.
Barely functional MVP.
It boots. Ship it.
Technical debt for future-you to handle.
You'll fix it later. (You won't.)
The code smells, but the deadline looms.
AI-generated slop with your name on it.
You shipped TODO comments as features.
The 'good enough' you'll regret tomorrow.
This will wake you up at 3am someday.
You know this is wrong. You ship it anyway.
Did you even test this?
Your GitHub commits say 'fix fix fix fix'.
This is a crime against computer science.
You copy-pasted from Stack Overflow without reading.
Future-you will curse present-you.
